Interface ShipBoardClient

All Known Implementing Classes:
Level1ShipBoard, Level2ShipBoard, ShipBoard
public interface ShipBoardClient
Interface defining all client-side operations for managing a ship board

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    boolean
    areConnectorsWellConnected(Component componentToPlace, int x, int y)

    • isValidPosition

      boolean isValidPosition(int x, int y)
      Checks whether the specified coordinates are valid and allowed on the board
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate
      y - The y-coordinate
      Returns:
      true if the position is valid, otherwise false

    • placeComponentWithFocus

      void placeComponentWithFocus(int x, int y) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Attempts to place the focused component at the specified coordinates
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate
      y - The y-coordinate
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the position is invalid or violates placement rules

    • isEngineDirectionWrong

      boolean isEngineDirectionWrong(Component componentToPlace)
      Checks whether the direction of an engine is incorrect
      Parameters:
      componentToPlace - The engine to check
      Returns:
      true if the direction is invalid, otherwise false

    • isPositionConnectedToShip

      boolean isPositionConnectedToShip(Component componentToPlace, int x, int y)
      Verifies that the component is properly connected to the ship through at least one non-EMPTY connector. A component connected only through EMPTY connectors is not considered properly connected.
      Parameters:
      componentToPlace - The component to validate.
      x - The x-coordinate.
      y - The y-coordinate.
      Returns:
      true if the component is properly connected through at least one non-EMPTY connector, otherwise false.

    • areEmptyConnectorsWellConnected

      boolean areEmptyConnectorsWellConnected(Component componentToPlace, int x, int y)
      Ensures that if an adjacent component has an EMPTY connector, the newly placed component also has the corresponding EMPTY connector
      Parameters:
      componentToPlace - The component to validate
      x - The x-coordinate
      y - The y-coordinate
      Returns:
      true if there are no conflicts, otherwise false

    • areConnectorsWellConnected

      boolean areConnectorsWellConnected(Component componentToPlace, int x, int y)
      Checks connector compatibility between the new component and adjacent components
      Parameters:
      componentToPlace - The component to validate
      x - The x-coordinate
      y - The y-coordinate
      Returns:
      true if the connectors are compatible, otherwise false

    • isAimingAComponent

      boolean isAimingAComponent(Component componentToPlace, int x, int y)

    • isComponentInFireDirection

      boolean isComponentInFireDirection(Component componentToPlace, int x, int y)
      Checks whether a cannon in an adjacent cell is pointed at the cell where the new component is being placed
      Parameters:
      componentToPlace - The component being placed
      x - The x-coordinate
      y - The y-coordinate
      Returns:
      true if there is a cannon aimed at this cell, otherwise false

    • isComponentInEngineDirection

      boolean isComponentInEngineDirection(Component componentToPlace, int x, int y)
      Checks whether an engine in an adjacent cell is pointed at the cell where the new component is being placed
      Parameters:
      componentToPlace - The component being placed
      x - The x-coordinate
      y - The y-coordinate
      Returns:
      true if there is an engine aimed at this cell, otherwise false

    • removeAndRecalculateShipParts

      Set<Set<Coordinates>> removeAndRecalculateShipParts(int x, int y) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Removes the component from the specified coordinates and recalculates any disconnected ship parts
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate
      y - The y-coordinate
      Returns:
      A list of sets, where each set contains the coordinates of components in a disconnected part
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If there is no component at the specified position

    • isThereACannon

      boolean isThereACannon(int pos, Direction direction)
      Determines whether there is a cannon in the specified row or column that is pointed in the given direction
      Parameters:
      pos - The row or column index
      direction - The direction to check
      Returns:
      true if there is a cannon firing in that direction, otherwise false
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the position is invalid

    • isThereADoubleCannon

      boolean isThereADoubleCannon(int pos, Direction direction)
      Determines whether there is a double cannon in the specified row or column that is pointed in the given direction
      Parameters:
      pos - The row or column index
      direction - The direction to check
      Returns:
      true if there is a double cannon firing in that direction, otherwise false
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the position is invalid

    • isItGoingToHitTheShip

      boolean isItGoingToHitTheShip(DangerousObj obj)
      Checks whether a DangerousObj will actually hit the ship based on its trajectory
      Parameters:
      obj - The DangerousObj to evaluate
      Returns:
      true if the object will impact the ship, otherwise false

    • getOrderedComponentsInDirection

      Component[] getOrderedComponentsInDirection(int pos, Direction direction) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns the components in a row or column in the order they would be hit by an object
      Parameters:
      pos - The row or column index
      direction - The direction of travel
      Returns:
      An array of Components in the order of impact
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the position or direction is invalid

    • isExposed

      boolean isExposed(int pos, Direction direction) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Checks whether the first non-null component found in a row or column has a non-empty connector facing outward
      Parameters:
      pos - The row or column index
      direction - The direction to check
      Returns:
      true if the first component found has a non-empty exposed connector, otherwise false
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the position is invalid

    • countExposed

      int countExposed()
      Calculates the total number of exposed connectors on the ship
      Returns:
      The total number of exposed connectors

    • getCrewMembers

      List<CrewMember> getCrewMembers()
      Retrieves all the crew members present in the ship's cabins
      Returns:
      A list of CrewMember objects currently on the ship

      List<Cabin> getCabin()

      Returns:
      A list of Cabin objects

      MainCabin getMainCabin()
      Returns the main cabin
      Returns:
      The main cabin or null if not present

      Set<Coordinates> getCabinCoordinatesWithNeighbors()
      Finds all cabins occupied by at least one crew member that are orthogonally adjacent to other occupied cabins
      Returns:
      A set of cabins that meet the adjacency criterion

    • isShipCorrect

      boolean isShipCorrect()
      Checks whether there are no incorrectly placed components on the ship
      Returns:
      true if the ship has no placement errors, otherwise false

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      The total engine power

    • identifyShipParts

      Set<Set<Coordinates>> identifyShipParts(int x, int y)
      Identifies contiguous parts of the ship stemming from the specified position
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate
      y - The y-coordinate
      Returns:
      A list of sets, where each set contains the coordinates of components in a connected part

    • bfsCollectPart

      Set<Coordinates> bfsCollectPart(int startX, int startY, boolean[][] visited)
      Performs a breadth-first search (BFS) to gather all connected cells starting from the provided coordinates
      Parameters:
      startX - The starting x-coordinate
      startY - The starting y-coordinate
      visited - A matrix of visited nodes
      Returns:
      A set of coordinates forming a connected part of the ship

    • removeShipPart

      void removeShipPart(Set<Coordinates> componentsPositions)
      Removes the specified set of components from the board and marks them as inactive
      Parameters:
      componentsPositions - A set of coordinates of components to remove

    • findFirstComponentInDirection

      int[] findFirstComponentInDirection(int pos, Direction direction)
      Finds the coordinates of the first non-null component in a given direction, starting from a specified row or column index
      Parameters:
      pos - The row or column index
      direction - The direction to search in
      Returns:
      An array [x, y] with the coordinates of the first component found
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the position is invalid

    • isDirectionCoveredByShield

      boolean isDirectionCoveredByShield(Direction direction)
      Checks whether there is at least one shield covering a specific direction
      Parameters:
      direction - The direction to check
      Returns:
      true if the direction is covered by a shield, otherwise false

      Parameters:

      Parameters:
      obj - The dangerous object
      Returns:
      true if the ship can defend itself, otherwise false

    • getCoordinatesAndCabinsWithCrew

      Map<Coordinates,Cabin> getCoordinatesAndCabinsWithCrew()
      Returns a map where keys are coordinates and values are Cabin components that have crew members. Only includes coordinates that have Cabin components with at least one inhabitant.
      Returns:
      A map of coordinates to Cabin objects with crew
